intro: Habenaria hookeri var. abbreviata, commonly known as the short-stemmed marsh orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and pale green to brownish stems. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pale yellow, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shady environments such as swamps and marshy areas. Its pseudobulbs are short and thick, supporting the plant's growth and storage of nutrients.
